chunks.chunk_text: Okay, so there are a lot of different dolls but when Ruth Hender saw her daughter playing paper dolls she thought that these dolls were made in the form of baby dolls But when her daughter was playing these baby dolls she would give them to nurses, police officers, firefighters, and other adult jobs and identities So Ruth thought that this may not be the case in the market right now So she thought this may not be the case in the market

chunks.chunk_text: So these are live events that they held to continue that legacy. You grew up playing Hot Wheels and then once you reach adulthood, what kind of Hot Wheels would you play? I'll build one of myself. You would go buy a BMW and modify it to look like your dream Hot Wheel. That's right.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: They don't only have Barbie, they have Hot Wheels.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: Unfortunately, I didn't grow up with Chatticathy. I didn't play with Chatticathy nor did I see any Chatticathys. But we would use Chatticathy to describe a person as being very talkative or likes to gossip in schools.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: Then we would call that girl Chatticathy.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: Let's play school. May I have a cookie? So short phrases.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: I think we had plush toys with strings on the back that could make barking sounds, cat meowing sounds, chicken sounds. So there was a big variety. But I suppose in the 60s, if you had anything that could speak, I think that would be the highest tech of all toys in the 60s.

chunks.chunk_text: That's right.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: So I got one for our 15 Minutes Fam. So I grew up in the mid 80s to the late early 90s.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: We were the TV generation, right? And then we had a lot of cartoons on TV. And obviously, Barbie and Ken, they had their own cartoon. I didn't watch it. Not very popular, by the way. But in the late 80s, early 90s, there was something very super popular, extremely popular that's made into movies today. Transformers. Transformers. And G.I. Joe. Oh, I know about Transformers. So Transformers and G.I. Joe. 15 Minutes Fam.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: She tells us, do you know which company makes G.I. Joe and Transformers? They are also one of the direct competitors of Mattel, the toy company in the world. Is it from America? Also from America. That's right. So G.I. Joe. I grew up with also figurines. Those were soldiers and it came with cartoons. And then we also had Transformers that started with comics and then cartoons.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: Obviously, the toy trucks and all the cars and then planes. And then later on, they had Transformers that were made into animals. Gorillas and not just trucks. So which company owns and designed and created the Transformers and G.I. Joe franchise? I really don't know. Let me check it on the Internet.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: Guys, if you know the answer, why don't you use the comment link down below and comment, and we will give you a shout out in the next episode, alright? Yes. So lots and lots of toy companies actually dominated our childhoods. Not just Mattel. A lot of different companies. And different generations, they have their classic toys. As for me, I was born in 1983.

chunks.chunk_text: My toy is like Pokemon. Oh, you grew up more the Japanese, right? The Japanese toys. Pokemon. The very first toy I had is a Pikachu doll. Really? A plush toy? Yes. Yes, a plush toy. Not a plastic doll. But I have to say the doll in like American style, like Barbie or something, it always reminds me about Chucky. So it's a bad memory for me. It's kind of a nightmare. So very interesting.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_精選詞彙播客Vocab Ep.180_ 雙語 Vocab ft. 週報時光機 最代表娃娃與品牌 Barbie and Mattel.json

chunks.chunk_text: In the mid-90s and mid-90s, horror movies, these horror movies about dolls and things like that came around. You know why? Because kids in the 80s grew up with dolls. So by the time you were a teenager, you're 16 or 18, you could handle horror movies. So turning your favorite doll into something that will kill you was a cult. It's something that's different, that will catch and attract you. You know, Chucky, most real adults then

chunks.chunk_text: wouldn't like Chucky. They would never understand Chucky or how scary Chucky is. But kids who grew up with dolls like that, it would haunt them for life, right? The first time I saw Chucky on TV is when I'm a kindergarten student. So it could become my nightmare. I don't like Chucky. So I kind of be afraid of dolls that looks like a little baby or something. Well, now fast forward to 2010.

chunks.chunk_text: 2020, the past 10 years, right? They made Chucky into like something funny. It's more comedy now. Less horror, right? It's sort of a cult comedy.
